translations: n．征服者，胜利者：征服或战胜其他国家、地区或人民的人。
· The conquerors imposed their culture on the conquered people.
征服者将他们的文化强加给被征服的人民。

phrs.translation: 征服者威廉（英国国王威廉一世，等于William I）

sentences.sentence: The people of an oppressed country obey their conquerors because they want to go on living.
sentences.translation: 一个被压迫国家的人民顺从他们的征服者，是因为他们想活下去。

sentences.sentence: After World War II, many Japanese abandoned the arranged marriage as part of their rush to adopt the more democratic ways of their American conquerors.
sentences.translation: 第二次世界大战后，许多日本人放弃了包办婚姻，这是他们急于采用美国征服者们更民主方式的一种举措。

sentences.sentence: Conquerors seized them as especially precious spoils of war; tourists came to see and hear these machines the way they made pilgrimages to sacred relics.
sentences.translation: 征服者把它们当做格外珍贵的战利品；游客来参观和聆听这些机器，就像朝拜圣地一样。
